availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund H. Parrish (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Parrish and Mary Parrish. Married to Milly S. Clarkson in Bourbon County on January 20, 1825. Married Virginia Briston Parrish in Winchester, Kentucky, in April 1834. Father of Ed. H. Parrish and Archibald Parrish. Married to Eliza A. G. Parrish. Postmaster in Clintonville, Kentucky, from March 1, 1836, to September 4, 1839. Farmer in Boone County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned thirty-two enslaved persons in Boone County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.
